Detailed Description

OBEX Manager. Singleton. Facade to global APOXI OBEX functionality.

The OBEX manager is a singleton class which provides access to several global interfaces affecting the APOXI OBEX module.

Warning;
Only the OBEX Application Interface is intended to be used by MMI, all other functions not mentioned in the next paragraph below may be used exclusively by APOXI OBEX.

The OBEX Application Interface provides methods suitable to present a choice of transport protocols to the MMI user, who can then select the appropriate transport. This funtionality must be implemented within a privileged MMI application, the so-called OBEX Application. A MMI application becomes the OBEX Application by calling RegisterObexApp() passing its own 'this' pointer as parameter. Whenever an OBEX client tries to open a transport connection without specifying the transport address (i.e. when ObexClientDispatcher::Open() is called with an OBEX URL parameter containing a wildcard character instead of a transport name like "*://"), an ObexAppMsg is sent to the OBEX Application requesting that the MMI user should be prompted to select a transport media.

This procedure is called Transport Address Selection. When the OBEX Application receives an ObexAppMsg, it should call EnumTransports() to obtain a set of available transports. The ObexTransportSet instance returned offers an iterator which can be used to access the individual transports an query their name. Then MMI should prompt the user to select on of the transports. After the user has chosen a transport SelectTransport() should be called passing a pointer to the selected OBEX transport instance. When the selection is cancelled by the MMI, a '0' pointer shall pe passed instead, this aborts the current Transport Address Selection and the ObexClientDispatcher which has initiated it is notified that Open() has failed with the result ObexResult::OperationAborted.

See also:
ObexTransportSet

ObexAbstractTransport

void ObexMngr::AbortSelection (  ObexOperationId  oper_id  ) 
 

Aborts transport selection by MMI user.

Should be called only by APOXI OBEX.

oper_id Operation id of the procedure to be aborted.

ObexProtocol& ObexMngr::GetProtocol (  const ObexChannel &  channel  )  const
 

Obtains the protocol object associated with a transport channel.

Parameters:
channel Valid transport channel. If the channel is invalid (i.e. not associated with any ObexProtocol) an assertion is triggered.
Returns:
Reference to the ObexProtocol object associated with channel. To specific protocol functionality, it should be downcasted to an adequate subclass.

void ObexMngr::RegisterObexApp (  Application &  obex_app  ) 
 

Lets an application take the role of the OBEX application.

Calling this method on an application object registers the app with the OBEX Manager. Whenever transport address selection is demanded, an ObexAppMsg is sent to this application known as OBEX app.

Parameters:
obex_app Reference to the OBEX application object.

ObexResult ObexMngr::SelectTransport (  ObexAbstractTransport *  selected  ) 
 

Return result of Transport Selection procedure.

Must be called by the responsible application at the end of the Transport Selection procedure to deliver the user's choice to APOXI OBEX and indicate completion of the procedure.

Parameters:
selected Pointer to ObexTransport instance chosen or '0' to cancel the Transport Address Selection procedure.
Returns:
ObexResult which evaluates to TRUE when the choice has been accepted by APOXI OBEX, FALSE otherwise.

ObexOperationId ObexMngr::StartSelection (  ObexTransportSet  sel_from  ) 
 

Requests transport selection by MMI user.

Invoking this function prompts the MMI user to pick a transport from the given set. User interaction will be carried out by the OBEX application, which is supposed to call SelectTransport() on completion of the procedure. When the procedure is already running, the request will be queued and launched after completion of the pending operation. Should be called only by APOXI OBEX.

Parameters:
sel_from ObexTransportSet to pick an address from.
Returns:
When the request has been accepted, a valid ObexOperationId is returned which will be included in the ObexTransportMsg sent when a transport is selected. In case of error, an invalid ObexOperationId is returned.
